title: The Media Cell Of SGGSIE&T, Nanded

items.title: RMAGEDDON 2k23¬†
items.summary: Heard the song 'Woh Din' and how it just takes us back…
items.content_html:
Heard the song 'Woh Din' and how it just takes us back into our childhood days. So, team RNXG also tried to recreate that ambience again through Rmegaddon by keeping the theme 'Retro Gaming'.

DAY 1

The day started with inauguration of event by the hands of faculty coordinator Dr.M.V. Bhalerao in the presence of all the faculty members and revealing the theme for the very first game i.e. Retromania (Roborace).

Let me ask you a question, what do you think could be the theme?? ( Hint: Which video game was played by most people in their childhood??) Yes, it's Mario and the Retromania was based on it and the way arena was printed and obstacles were set up, it gave us the complete nostalgia!! The event was hosted well by the commentators Nikhilesh Deshmukh, Prasad Chede and Atharva Jagdale.

Some teams managed to cross all the obstacle that too within times and some unfortunately weren't able to complete it but you know learning is more important rather than winning. From all the teams, eight got into the semifinals, and as the event was by RNXG, they had a surprise for the contestants, some obstacles were added in the semifinals round to make the game more competitive.


And the whole event was covered by The Media Cell live.

DAY 2

The another was booked for the games Pac Runner (Line follower) having the the theme pacman and the Ninja Clash (Robo Sumo) based on the game Ninja Turtles.


For Pac runner, very few were able to complete it but the hardwork all the teams did for making it is so appreciative!!

For Ninja Clash various matches were held, and as it was a match of two, one team won and another team tried their best to won, everyone did so well, made the best bots possible..but at the end it's a game, so winner could only be one.


At the end there were quarter finals, semi finals and finals, the atmosphere was so energetic, everyone was hooting and cheering for the teams.
The event was concluded with the Prize Distribution Ceremony.


And winners were-

For Retromania
1) Team The Above All
2) Team Jaguar
3) Team Edge runners

For Pac runner
1) Team Thunder
2) Team Eagle Strike
3) Team Robusta

For Ninja Clash
1) Team Notion
2) Team DSUV
3) Team A2RP

Congratulations to all the winners and best of luck to all the contestants fir their future!!

items.title: SEARCH N‚Äô DESTROY (RNXG)
items.summary: Date : Saturday, 14 January 2023 Event Name : Search N‚Äô Destroy…
items.content_html:
Date : Saturday, 14 January 2023
Event Name : Search N‚Äô Destroy (Line Follower Competition)
Rank : RUNNER UP TEAM
Venue :¬†College of Engineering Pune (COEP)
Associated with : RNXG (Official Robo Club of SGGSIE&T,Nanded)

This BOT designed to follow a line or path already pre determined by the user. This line or path maybe as simple as physical black line on the white floor.¬†

The competition was set for January 14 (Saturday). Search N‚Äô Destroy is a Line
Follower competition which was held at College of Engineering, Pune¬†

A team of five participants consisting of two second year students and three
first year students was successful.

List of participants-

Tasks assigned:
- Teams must build an autonomous robot which can trace the line.
- The path will have 4 checkpoints, 2 of which will be fixed in their positions
and the two will be variable checkpoints. It is mandatory to cross all the
checkpoints.
- The remaining two checkpoints (on the ground only) will be placed just
before the commencement of match (before dry run).
- The starting procedure of the bot must consist of a simple toggle switch to
start the movement. It must not involve giving the bot any manual force or
impulse in any direction.
- The machine should either stop or trace back after deposition of box in the
white space between the gap.
- Machine should not enter opponent‚Äôs area. Entering an opponent‚Äôs area has
a penalty of 50 points.

Team from Shri Guru Gobind Singhji Institute of Engineering and Technology.
and Being Part of RNXG Official Robo Club of SGGSIE&T
The prototype for competition was made by using components as below;
1) Arduino Nano (Microcontroller-Board)
2) RLS-08 (IR Sensor Module)
3) N20-6V-600 Rpm Micro Metal Gear Motor
4) Metal Ball Caster Wheel
5) L298N 2A Based Motor Driver Module
Since the first and second rounds of the competition team was in lead and
successfully covers all checkpoints in minimum time.

Conclusions:
The objective of the line following robot is to follow a line on its given path
which is obtained for which it uses IR sensor Array (RLS-08) which detects the
line and sends the information to Arduino Nano and then to L293N Motor
Driver which controls the working of the wheel.
COEP Mind spark 2023 gives great opportunity to participate and showcase our
programming and intellectual skills.

A word of appreciation to all the participants from Our Team!

In a world where technology is constantly evolving, participating in a technical event is a testament to your passion for innovation and problem-solving. You have proven that you have the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in today's fast-paced, technology-driven world.

This accomplishment is not just a personal achievement, but it also reflects the strength of your school or college. Your performance showcases the quality of education and training that you have received and is a source of pride for your institution.

As you move forward in your careers, remember that success is not just about winning awards and recognition. It's about the impact that you make in your communities and the positive difference that you bring to people's lives. Your technical skills are valuable assets and you have the potential to make a real difference in the world.

Once again, congratulations on your outstanding performance. Your hard work and dedication is truly inspiring and we wish you all the best as you continue to chase your dreams.

¬†

items.title: Walk On The Right
items.summary: The "Walk on the Right" movement is a joint initiative by the…
items.content_html:
The "Walk on the Right" movement is a joint initiative by the Nanded Police and the Regional Transport Office (RTO) of Nanded, aimed at promoting pedestrian safety and reducing road accidents. This movement is focused on educating the public about the importance of walking on the right side of the road, especially in crowded areas and near pedestrian crossings.

This movement was initiated in response to the growing number of road accidents involving pedestrians, particularly in areas with heavy foot traffic. By promoting the concept of walking on the right, the Nanded Police and RTO aim to reduce the chances of collisions between pedestrians and vehicles. Additionally, this movement also emphasizes the importance of pedestrian safety and encourages people to be more aware of their surroundings while walking on the road.

The "Walk on the Right" movement involves several awareness drives and campaigns aimed at educating the public about the importance of walking on the right side of the road. This includes workshops and seminars for school children, distribution of flyers and posters, and road safety demonstrations. The Nanded Police and RTO also work closely with local organizations and community groups to spread the message of this movement to a wider audience.

In addition to promoting pedestrian safety, the "Walk on the Right" movement also aims to raise awareness about traffic laws and regulations. The Nanded Police and RTO work closely with local authorities to ensure that the road infrastructure is equipped with proper pedestrian crossings, zebra crossings, and footpaths to make it safer for people to walk on the road.

items.title: Utsav 2k23
items.summary: UTSAV is a three-day cultural event organized by SGGSIET, Nanded. It is…
items.content_html:
UTSAV is a three-day cultural event organized by SGGSIET, Nanded. It is a platform for the students of the institute to showcase their talents and participate in various cultural activities. The event is managed by Team UTSAV, who are responsible for the successful execution of the entire program. This team comprises of dedicated students who work tirelessly to ensure that all the arrangements are made in a smooth and efficient manner.

During the UTSAV, students participate in a wide range of cultural activities such as singing, dancing, drama, and poetry recitation, to name a few. The event is also graced by the presence of renowned celebrities, who add to the excitement and glamour of the occasion. The celebrities interact with the students and encourage them to pursue their passions and interests.

Team UTSAV also plays an important role in conducting various cultural activities in the campus throughout the year. They are responsible for organizing workshops, competitions, and other events that help to foster a sense of community and creativity among the students.

In conclusion, UTSAV is an important event in the calendar of SGGSIET, Nanded, and serves as a platform for students to showcase their talents and interact with each other. The hard work and dedication of Team UTSAV helps to ensure that the event is a resounding success and that the students leave with cherished memories.

items.title: Pragyaa 2k23
items.summary: Pragyaa is the annual technical festival organized by Shri Guru Gobind Singhji…
items.content_html:
Pragyaa is the annual technical festival organized by Shri Guru Gobind Singhji Institute of Engineering and Technology in Nanded, India. It is a national level event that attracts students from various engineering colleges and universities from all over the country.

The festival usually consists of a variety of events and competitions in fields such as robotics, programming, technical quiz, coding, and other technical as well as cultural events like music, dance, drama, fashion shows, and photography. It provides a platform for students to showcase their technical and cultural talents, and also provides an opportunity for students to network and learn from each other.

Pragyaa is a highly anticipated event in the academic calendar and is known for its well-organized events, exciting prizes, and its reputation as a hub for young tech enthusiasts and creative minds. It is an ideal platform for students to gain practical knowledge and experience, interact with experts and professionals in the industry, and develop important skills such as teamwork, leadership, and problem-solving.

Overall, Pragyaa is a celebration of technology, creativity, and talent, and it is a perfect opportunity for students to enrich their college experience and have fun at the same time.

items.title: Zenith 2k23
items.summary: After the grand success of Zenith'20 , Zenith'21 & Zenith'22 We are…
items.content_html:
After the grand success of Zenith'20 , Zenith'21 & Zenith'22 We are back with Zenith'23 - the 7th edition of our fiesta. This year the tagline is "Devour the Victory!!!". Last year this Sports extravaganza was scheduled in the month of February 2023 and was organised online .

There were many games that included Workout Wonders, NBA Live , Carrom Disc Pool, Free Style Football, Sports Quiz at intercollegiate levels and table tennis, chess, football, rink football, volleyball, kabaddi, cricket, basketball, handball, yoga,tug of war, ahtletics at intra-collegiate levels.

With the sport activities we conducted some social activites like orphanage activities, "run for health" (dream marathon). Prizes worth over 4.5 lakhs were awarded in the previous edition of ZENITH. The intercollegiate fiesta Zenith'20 , Zenith'21 & Zenith'22 competed among various Engineering colleges across the state.

The 8th edition of Zenith, the annual state level sports extravaganza organized by Shri Guru Gobind Singhji Institute of Engineering and Technology in Nanded, India, is coming soon with the tagline "Devour the Victory". This year's festival promises to be even more exciting and action-packed than previous years, with a wide range of indoor and outdoor sports events for students from colleges and universities across the state to participate in and showcase their athletic abilities.

Zenith is known for its well-organized events, exciting prizes, and its reputation as a hub for young athletes and sports enthusiasts. The festival provides a great platform for students to stay active, have fun, and develop important life skills such as teamwork, leadership, and communication.

This year's event is expected to draw a large number of participants, making it one of the largest and most anticipated sports festivals in the state. The festival will provide an opportunity for students to showcase their skills, challenge each other, and participate in a fun and competitive atmosphere.

The 8th edition of Zenith is shaping up to be an unforgettable experience, and the organizers are working hard to make sure that this year's festival will be even more memorable than previous years. Whether participating or spectating, Zenith promises to be a thrilling and exciting event that will be enjoyed by all involved. So come and join the fun, and let's Devour the Victory together!

items.content_html:
Clubs & Events at SGGSIE&T‚ú®

¬†

¬†

items.title: 74th Republic Day
items.summary: Today, We Celebrated our 74th Republic Day at SGGSIE&T, Nanded. 73 years…
items.content_html:
Today, We Celebrated our 74th Republic Day at SGGSIE&T, Nanded. 73 years ago, we formally became a Republic and adopted our constitution on this very day. Republic Day fills each and every one of us with strong emotions. It brings to mind powerful images of India's military, parading to the world with its full might and grandeur. It inspires us with the moving accounts of the bravery and gallantry award winners.

On this glorious day, Team Drishti created a huge rangoli filled with vibrant colors that grabbed everyone's attention and became the highlight of the occasion.¬†

The event began with Flag Hosting by Our Hon. Director Sir and Chief guest of the day Shri Baba Sukhwinder Singh Ji, followed by salutes and marches by the guards. "Avaroh" the music club of the institute also graced the occasion with their mellifluent patriotic chores.¬†

The College chose this day to felicitate the sport achievement of the students in various tournaments. The college men's Football team, basketball team, chess champion boys; women's handball team, volleyball team, chess champion girls, and the most special our college cricket team that won the inter-college cricket tournament were felicitated.

A blood Donation camp was organized by NSS that received a remarkable response from college students. This was really a great initiative towards mankind and the nation to fill the droning blood banks.

A Street play was performed by "Gandharwa" the drama club of the institute.

The play "Kya Fark Padhta Hai" really took us into deep thought about the corruption, irrelevant politics, and cyber crimes prevailing in the country. It also questioned us about what role we play in stopping these crimes and supporting the nation.

Our institute has over 3000 students and so many faculties that come from different cultural, linguistic, social, religious, political, and ideological areas. Yes!! we are different but we are of the same kind!!

¬†

An effort by us to remark this day....üáÆüá≥

items.title: GuruPurab 2k23
items.summary: Gurupurab of Gurugobind Singh Ji Maharaj- On 20th Jan our institute celebrated…
items.content_html:
Gurupurab of Gurugobind Singh Ji Maharaj-

On 20th Jan our institute celebrated the Gurupurab of Shri Guru Gobind Singh ji Maharaj. Guru Gobind Singh ji was the 10th Sikh Guru. He was a spiritual master and a warrior. he made various significant contributions to Sikhism and was solely responsible for the establishment of Khalsa pants. he initiated the five K's tradition that held a lot of importance. Apart from establishing the khalsa, Guru Gobind Singh declared that guru Granth sahib is the permanent Sikh guru, and his teachings are respected and followed worldwide.

The ceremony was endowed with the presence of gurudwara Sants - Sant Baba Ram Singh Ji, Baba Sukhwinder Singh ji, and Jattedar Baba Teja Singh Ji. The Ceremony began with Pushp Arpan and lamp enlightenment at Guru Gobind Singh ji's memorial. The guests of honor of the ceremony were welcomed by our Director sir with Shawl and bouquet.

The ceremony was further preceded by a student speech on the life of Shri Guru Gobind Singh ji and his sacrifices. The student mentioned that Guru Gobind Singh ji was born in Bihar Patna and was known as Govind rai in his early years. Our director sir also paid respect to this occasion by thanking the chief guests and remembering Guru Gobind Singh ji's teachings to steer the students.

The guests of honor Shri Baba ram Singh ji and Shri baba Sukhwinder Singh ji also embarked on the ceremony with their words of wisdom. They encouraged the students to maintain the dignity of the college and always be proud to be a part of this institute.

The guests of honor also thanked the director and staff members of our institute for the smooth functioning of the institute by offering their blessings in the form of shawls.

The ceremony was concluded with a vote of thanks by Pokhare Sir and Kokare Sir Dean Academics of the institute.

Prasad was distributed to all the attendees after the ceremony and in honor of the Jayanti, a langar was organized on the textile lawn of the campus for students and staff members. Everyone enjoyed the delicious food and with this, the ceremony concluded.

¬†

items.title: Face Painting 2k23
items.summary: Team Drishti organized one of the most amazing events of our institute,…
items.content_html:
Team Drishti organized one of the most amazing events of our institute, which was Face Paintingü§©. Every face was not only filled with colors but with characters that had a story to tell!!

Some were roaming with their horror faces and some with cutely painted faces but I think everyone's favorite was the one who carried 'The boys' tag and who doesn't love music, not just that but enjoying the music along with painting, artists know that that's why they created a vibe that people will not only love but will remember. üíù
Not everyone participated but was too interested to get their faces painted, so some drew tattoos on their faces. ü§≠

Winners are not those who do things best than anyone else but who do things uniquely!!

Winners for the event were Manthan Khose, Chaitanya Panchal, and Bhagyashree Narwadkar, how amazing they created that messed face painting.. followed by Pranoti Dhone, Swati Wankhade, Gunjan Dadhiwale who were the 1st runner ups and the 2nd runner ups were the freshers Rajlaxmi Watgule, Vipakshi Mate, Ashutosh Hamand.¬†

It was a great experience and everyone had so much fun! Something that's carved into everyones momeory stone.‚ú®
